Description: Bone doll; stylised representation of a tall thin standing female figure, shown naked, with outline and details summarily indicated by broad shallow and fine narrow incised lines executed with different tools and the eyes and navel indicated by drilled dotted circles; drilled laterally through the shoulders for the attachment of separate arms, now missing; almost flat sawn and polished reverse; complete except for the separately attached arms.
Curator's comments: On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314.
Exhibition history: 2022, 4 February - 22 May, Switzerland,Museum Rietberg, In the Name of the Image
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Donated by: Dr W L Hildburgh
Additional IDs: Previous owner/ex-collection number: 4871 (original V&A number when deposited there on loan)
